thread.title: SAS veteran ‘raped woman soldier in his sleep’ after returning from six-month Afghanistan tour
thread.title_full: SAS veteran ‘raped woman soldier in his sleep’ after returning from six-month Afghanistan tour

author: oloveridgegreene
title: SAS veteran ‘raped woman soldier in his sleep’ after returning from six-month Afghanistan tour
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments AN SAS veteran accused of raping an ex-soldier claimed he was sleepwalking and could not remember having sex, a court heard today. 
Peter Atilla, 46, denies attacking the woman on the day he returned from a six-month tour in Afghanistan. Athena Picture Agency 6 Peter Atilla is charged with raping a female soldier 
Jurors heard the warrant officer, who served with the Royal Logistics Corps for 26 years, told cops: “I have a bad recollection of it. 
“Maybe I was sleepwalking.” 
Atilla became a reservist after leaving the Army in 2006 and was posted to Afghanistan on attachment with the SAS in 2012. 
On his return in 2013, the woman agreed to spend the night with him. PA:Press Association 6 The 46-year-old denies the 2013 attack (stock picture) 
But prosecutor Dyfed Thomas said: “She said he could sleep in her bed and was happy to have a cuddle. 
“But she made it clear they were not going to have sex. 
“She fell asleep with Atilla cuddled up behind her. 
“She was woken by her baby crying and realised she was naked with Atilla on top of her. 
“His eyes were open, he was biting his lower lip and he was sweating.” 
The jury was told that had Atilla managed to remove the woman’s pyjamas and have sex without her waking up. CASCADE NEWS The victim’s mother spoke at Merthyr Tydfil crown court RELATED STORIES SLEEPING WITH THE ENEMY British war hero who helped create the SAS was engaged to a NAZI before taking on Hitler’s forces PAEDO SQUADDIE CAGED Soldier jailed for 27 years after paying fellow paedo £50 to let him watch as he raped child, 3 'MUSLIM BAN' HITS HERO British soldier awarded Victoria Cross for action in Iraq 'humiliated' in US by THREE-HOUR airport quiz over passport stamp terror at the louvre Dramatic moment soldiers shoot Louvre terror suspect seconds after he 'stabbed' trooper with a machete while shouting 'Allahu Akbar' in front of terrified tourists COMPO CLAIM BID Ex-soldier and champion bodybuilder 'FAKED car crash in £10k bogus compo claim' SCHOOL TRIP TERROR Brit students trapped inside Louvre are 'safe', school confirms in message to terrified parents 
His alleged victim, who cannot be named for legal reasons, said: “I woke up to see him looking down at me like he was doing press-ups. 
“I was so shocked, it felt like hours but it was seconds.” 
Asked why she did not wake sooner, she said: “I don’t know why. 
“It happened, I have no explanation as to why it happened.” 
She also said Atilla had returned from Afghanistan “angry and was drinking and smoking heavily”. Getty Images
